alert.note: Alert for Appomattox; Charlotte (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Appomattox. In south central Virginia, Charlotte. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain which prompted the advisory has exited the area, however, additional light to moderate rain is still expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Caldwells Creek, Bowler Creek, Left Hand Fork, Little Cub Creek, Falling River, Maple Spring Branch, Butterwood Creek, Long Creek, Bear Creek and Little Falling River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pamplin City... Evergreen... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
